events.originalText: The SpaceX launch vehicle Falcon Heavy made its first flight (launch pictured).
events.subtitle: SpaceX
events.headline: SpaceX Falcon Heavy Successfully Completes First Flight

events.originalText: Lockheed Corporation president Carl Kotchian admitted that the company had paid out approximately US$3 million in bribes to the office of Japanese prime minister Kakuei Tanaka.
events.subtitle: Lockheed Corporation
events.headline: Lockheed Corporation President Admits to $3 Million in Bribes

events.originalText: The aircraft carrying the Manchester United football team crashed while attempting to take off from Munich-Riem Airport in West Germany, killing 8 players and 23 people in total (news reel featured).
events.subtitle: Manchester United F.C.
events.headline: Manchester United Football Team Plane Crash Kills 8 Players

events.originalText: A train derailed while crossing a temporary wooden trestle in Woodbridge, New Jersey, causing 85 deaths.
events.subtitle: Woodbridge train derailment
events.headline: Woodbridge Train Derailment Results in 85 Deaths

events.originalText: More than 65,000 workers in Seattle began a five-day general strike to gain higher wages after two years of U.S. World War I wage controls.
events.subtitle: Seattle
events.headline: Seattle Workers Begin Five-Day General Strike for Higher Wages

events.originalText: Union forces earned one of their first important victories in the American Civil War at the Battle of Fort Henry in western Tennessee.
events.subtitle: Union (American Civil War)
events.headline: Union Forces Victorious at Battle of Fort Henry in Civil War

events.originalText: British representatives and Māori chiefs first signed the Treaty of Waitangi, widely regarded to be the founding document of New Zealand.
events.subtitle: Māori people
events.headline: Treaty of Waitangi Signed, Founding Document of New Zealand

events.originalText: The first ship of the American Colonization Society departed from New York for West Africa with 86 African-American emigrants aboard to found the colony of Liberia.
events.subtitle: American Colonization Society
events.headline: First Ship of American Colonization Society Departs for Liberia

events.originalText: British official Stamford Raffles signed a treaty with Sultan Hussein Shah of Johor, establishing Singapore as a trading post for the East India Company.
events.subtitle: Stamford Raffles
events.headline: Singapore Established as Trading Post by Stamford Raffles

events.originalText: Napoleonic Wars: A British naval squadron captured or destroyed five French ships of the line at the Battle of San Domingo in the Caribbean Sea.
events.subtitle: Napoleonic Wars
events.headline: British Navy Defeats French Ships at Battle of San Domingo

events.originalText: Massachusetts became the sixth state to ratify the constitution of the United States.
events.subtitle: Massachusetts
events.headline: Massachusetts Ratifies US Constitution as Sixth State

events.originalText: France and the United States signed the Treaty of Amity and Commerce and the Treaty of Alliance, respectively establishing commercial and military ties between the two nations.
events.subtitle: Treaty of Amity and Commerce (France–United States)
events.headline: France and US Establish Commercial and Military Ties with Treaties
